enumDescriptions: Check for matching action names across all games.
Check for matching action names only within the same game.
actionScope.markdownDescription: In what scope to check for matching action names when registering or unregistering actions. According to the specification, `global` is the correct behavior. Has no effect if `conflictPolicy` is set to `allow`.

allowedSchemaKeys.description: Schema keys marked as unsupported which Tony should not log warnings for.

enumDescriptions: Ignore the new action and keep the old action.
Overwrite the old action with the new action.
Do not check for duplicate action names.
conflictPolicy.markdownDescription: What to do when trying to register an action with the same name as an already registered action. According to the specification, `ignore` is the correct behavior, but changing to `overwrite` has been proposed.

deleteActionsOnDisconnect.description: If true, deletes all actions associated with a client when it disconnects.

logLevel.description: Minimum log level to log. Log levels are DEBUG < INFO < WARNING < ERROR < CRITICAL.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Things that usually should be handled internally by an SDK (e.g. action IDs), as well as some internals of the application. Debug messages alone are not a cause for concern.
Things that will likely not cause problems with Neuro, but might point to some other issue (e.g. `action/result` with no message).
Things that do not comply with the API specification, but which Tony can still tolerate (e.g. trying to register actions before sending `startup`). These will likely cause problems with Neuro.
Things that make it impossible to process a command (e.g. receiving invalid JSON). These will definitely cause problems with Neuro.
Something went wrong and Tony will likely have to be restarted.
